intro: Amphipogon brownii, commonly known as the Brown's amphipogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
